service: Managed integrations is a feature of AWS IoT Device Management that enables developers to quickly build innovative IoT solutions. Customers can use managed integrations to automate device setup workflows and support interoperability across many devices, regardless of device vendor or connectivity protocol. This allows developers to use a single user-interface to control, manage, and operate a range of devices.

operations.CreateAccountAssociation: Creates a new account association via the destination id.
operations.CreateConnectorDestination: Create a connector destination for connecting a cloud-to-cloud (C2C) connector to the customer's Amazon Web Services account.
operations.CreateCredentialLocker:
Create a credential locker.

This operation will not trigger the creation of all the manufacturing resources.
operations.CreateDestination: Create a notification destination such as Kinesis Data Streams that receive events and notifications from Managed integrations. Managed integrations uses the destination to determine where to deliver notifications.
operations.CreateEventLogConfiguration: Set the event log configuration for the account, resource type, or specific resource.
operations.CreateManagedThing: Creates a managed thing. A managed thing contains the device identifier, protocol supported, and capabilities of the device in a data model format defined by Managed integrations.
operations.CreateNotificationConfiguration: Creates a notification configuration. A configuration is a connection between an event type and a destination that you have already created.
operations.CreateOtaTask: Create an over-the-air (OTA) task to target a device.
operations.CreateOtaTaskConfiguration: Create a configuraiton for the over-the-air (OTA) task.
operations.CreateProvisioningProfile: Create a provisioning profile for a device to execute the provisioning flows using a provisioning template. The provisioning template is a document that defines the set of resources and policies applied to a device during the provisioning process.
operations.DeleteAccountAssociation:
Remove a third-party account association for an end user.

You must first call the DeregisterAccountAssociation to remove the connection between the managed thing and the third-party account before calling the DeleteAccountAssociation API.
operations.DeleteConnectorDestination:
Delete a connector destination linked to a cloud-to-cloud (C2C) connector.

Deletion can't be done if the account association has used this connector destination.
operations.DeleteCredentialLocker:
Delete a credential locker.

This operation can't be undone and any existing device won't be able to use IoT managed integrations.
operations.DeleteDestination: Deletes a notification destination specified by name.
operations.DeleteManagedThing: Delete a managed thing. For direct-connected and hub-connected devices connecting with Managed integrations via a controller, all of the devices connected to it will have their status changed to PENDING. It is not possible to remove a cloud-to-cloud device.
operations.DeregisterAccountAssociation: Deregister an account association from a managed thing.
operations.GetAccountAssociation: Get an account association for an Amazon Web Services account linked to a customer-managed destination.
operations.GetCloudConnector: Get configuration details for a cloud connector.
operations.GetConnectorDestination: Get connector destination details linked to a cloud-to-cloud (C2C) connector.
operations.GetCredentialLocker: Get information on an existing credential locker
operations.GetCustomEndpoint: Returns the IoT managed integrations custom endpoint.
operations.GetDefaultEncryptionConfiguration: Retrieves information about the default encryption configuration for the Amazon Web Services account in the default or specified region. For more information, see Key management in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.
operations.GetDeviceDiscovery: Get the current state of a device discovery.
operations.GetManagedThing: Get details of a managed thing including its attributes and capabilities.
operations.GetManagedThingCapabilities: Get the capabilities for a managed thing using the device ID.
operations.GetManagedThingCertificate: Retrieves the certificate PEM for a managed IoT thing.
operations.GetManagedThingConnectivityData: Get the connectivity status of a managed thing.
operations.GetManagedThingMetaData:
Get the metadata information for a managed thing.

The managedThing metadata parameter is used for associating attributes with a managedThing that can be used for grouping over-the-air (OTA) tasks. Name value pairs in metadata can be used in the OtaTargetQueryString parameter for the CreateOtaTask API operation.
operations.GetManagedThingState: Returns the managed thing state for the given device Id.
operations.GetNotificationConfiguration: Get a notification configuration for a specified event type.
operations.GetOtaTask: Get details of the over-the-air (OTA) task by its task id.
operations.GetOtaTaskConfiguration: Get a configuraiton for the over-the-air (OTA) task.
operations.GetProvisioningProfile: Get a provisioning profile by template name.
operations.GetRuntimeLogConfiguration: Get the runtime log configuration for a specific managed thing.
operations.GetSchemaVersion: Gets a schema version with the provided information.
operations.ListAccountAssociations: Lists all account associations, with optional filtering by connector destination ID.
operations.ListCloudConnectors: Returns a list of connectors filtered by its Lambda Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and type.
operations.ListConnectorDestinations: Lists all connector destinations, with optional filtering by cloud connector ID.
operations.ListCredentialLockers: List information on an existing credential locker.
operations.ListDeviceDiscoveries: Lists all device discovery tasks, with optional filtering by type and status.
operations.ListDiscoveredDevices: Lists all devices discovered during a specific device discovery task.
operations.ListEventLogConfigurations: List all event log configurations for an account.
operations.ListManagedThingAccountAssociations: Lists all account associations for a specific managed thing.
operations.ListManagedThingSchemas: List schemas associated with a managed thing.
operations.ListManagedThings: Listing all managed things with provision for filters.
operations.ListOtaTaskConfigurations: List all of the over-the-air (OTA) task configurations.
operations.ListOtaTaskExecutions: List all of the over-the-air (OTA) task executions.
operations.ListProvisioningProfiles: List the provisioning profiles within the Amazon Web Services account.
operations.ListSchemaVersions: Lists schema versions with the provided information.
operations.PutDefaultEncryptionConfiguration: Sets the default encryption configuration for the Amazon Web Services account. For more information, see Key management in the AWS IoT SiteWise User Guide.
operations.PutRuntimeLogConfiguration: Set the runtime log configuration for a specific managed thing or for all managed things as a group.
operations.RegisterAccountAssociation: Registers an account association with a managed thing, establishing a connection between a device and a third-party account.
operations.RegisterCustomEndpoint: Customers can request IoT managed integrations to manage the server trust for them or bring their own external server trusts for the custom domain. Returns an IoT managed integrations endpoint.
operations.ResetRuntimeLogConfiguration: Reset a runtime log configuration for a specific managed thing.
operations.SendConnectorEvent: Relays third-party device events for a connector such as a new device or a device state change event.
operations.SendManagedThingCommand: Send the command to the device represented by the managed thing.
operations.StartAccountAssociationRefresh: Initiates a refresh of an existing account association to update its authorization and connection status.
operations.StartDeviceDiscovery: This API is used to start device discovery for hub-connected and third-party-connected devices. The authentication material (install code) is delivered as a message to the controller instructing it to start the discovery.
operations.UpdateAccountAssociation: Updates the properties of an existing account association.
operations.UpdateConnectorDestination: Updates the properties of an existing connector destination.
operations.UpdateDestination: Update a destination specified by name.
operations.UpdateEventLogConfiguration: Update an event log configuration by log configuration ID.
operations.UpdateManagedThing: Update the attributes and capabilities associated with a managed thing.

refs.Device$ConnectorDeviceId:
The device id as defined by the connector.

This parameter is used for cloud-to-cloud devices only.
refs.DiscoveredDeviceSummary$ConnectorDeviceI: The third-party device identifier as defined by the connector. This identifier must not contain personal identifiable information (PII).
refs.GetManagedThingResponse$ConnectorDeviceI:
The third-party device id as defined by the connector. This device id must not contain personal identifiable information (PII).

This parameter is used for cloud-to-cloud devices only.
refs.ListManagedThingsRequest$ConnectorDevice: Filter managed things by the connector device ID they are associated with. When specified, only managed things with this connector device ID will be returned.
refs.ManagedThingSummary$ConnectorDeviceId:
The third-party device id as defined by the connector. This device id must not contain personal identifiable information (PII).

This parameter is used for cloud-to-cloud devices only.
refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$ConnectorDevic:
The third-party device id as defined by the connector. This device id must not contain personal identifiable information (PII).

This parameter is used for cloud-to-cloud devices only.

refs.Device$ConnectorDeviceName: The name of the device as defined by the connector.
refs.DiscoveredDeviceSummary$ConnectorDeviceN: The name of the device as defined by the connector or third-party system.

refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$Message:
The device state change event payload.

This parameter will include the following three fields:

  • uri: schema auc://<PARTNER-DEVICE-ID>/ResourcePath (The Resourcepath corresponds to an OCF resource.)

  • op: For device state changes, this field must populate as n+d.

  • cn: The content depends on the OCF resource referenced in ResourcePath.

refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$Operation:
The Open Connectivity Foundation (OCF) operation requested to be performed on the managed thing.

The field op can have a value of "I" or "U". The field "cn" will contain the capability types.

refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$OperationVersi: The Open Connectivity Foundation (OCF) security specification version for the operation being requested on the managed thing. For more information, see OCF Security Specification.

refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$StatusCode: The status code of the Open Connectivity Foundation (OCF) operation being performed on the managed thing.

refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$ConnectorId: The id of the connector between the third-party cloud provider and IoT managed integrations.
refs.SendConnectorEventResponse$ConnectorId: The id of the connector between the third-party cloud provider and IoT managed integrations.

refs.GetManagedThingResponse$ConnectorPolicyI:
The id of the connector policy.

This parameter is used for cloud-to-cloud devices only.
refs.ListManagedThingsRequest$ConnectorPolicy: Filter on a connector policy id for a managed thing.
refs.ManagedThingSummary$ConnectorPolicyId:
The id of the connector policy.

This parameter is used for cloud-to-cloud devices only.

refs.GetAccountAssociationResponse$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the account association.
refs.GetCredentialLockerResponse$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the credential locker.
refs.GetDestinationResponse$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the customer-managed destination.
refs.GetDeviceDiscoveryResponse$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the device discovery request.
refs.GetManagedThingResponse$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the managed thing.
refs.GetNotificationConfigurationResponse$Tag: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the notification configuration.
refs.GetOtaTaskResponse$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the over-the-air (OTA) task.
refs.GetProvisioningProfileResponse$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the provisioning profile.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the resource.
refs.StartDeviceDiscoveryRequest$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the device discovery request.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Tags: A set of key/value pairs that are used to manage the resource

refs.CreateOtaTaskRequest$Target: The device targeted for the over-the-air (OTA) task.
refs.GetOtaTaskResponse$Target: The device targeted for the over-the-air (OTA) task.

refs.GetOtaTaskResponse$TaskProcessingDetails: The processing details of all over-the-air (OTA) tasks.

refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$UserId: The id of the third-party cloud provider.

refs.AbortConfigCriteria$ThresholdPercentage: The minimum percentage of over-the-air (OTA) task execution failures that must occur to initiate the last abort.

refs.OAuthConfig$tokenEndpointAuthenticationS: The authentication scheme used when requesting tokens from the token endpoint.

refs.OAuthConfig$tokenUrl: The token URL for the OAuth service, where authorization codes are exchanged for access tokens.

refs.SendConnectorEventRequest$TraceId: The trace request identifier. This is generated by IoT managed integrations and can be used to trace this command and its related operations in CloudWatch.
refs.SendManagedThingCommandResponse$TraceId: The trace request identifier. This is generated by IoT managed integrations and can be used to trace this command and its related operations in CloudWatch.

UnauthorizedException.base: You are not authorized to perform this operation.

refs.GetManagedThingResponse$UniversalProduct: The universal product code (UPC) of the device model. The UPC is typically used in the United States of America and Canada.

refs.GetManagedThingResponse$UpdatedAt: The timestamp value of when the managed thing was last updated at.

refs.RuntimeLogConfigurations$UploadLog: Configuration to enable or disable uploading of runtime logs to the cloud.

refs.RuntimeLogConfigurations$UploadPeriodMin: Configuration to set the time interval in minutes between each batch of runtime logs that the device uploads to the cloud.

ValidationException.base: A validation error occurred when performing the API request.

refs.CapabilitySchemaItem$Schema: The actual schema definition that describes the capability's properties, actions, and events.
refs.ManagedThingSchemaListItem$Schema: The validation schema for one schema item associated with a managed thing.
